inclusion.criterion: elevated serum IGF-1 level above age- and sex-based normal values
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age

inclusion.criterion: growth hormone(GH) suppression to < 1.0 ng/ml after a 75 gm oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: visible pituitary adenoma on high quality pituitary MRI without and with gadolinium
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: recent brain MRI confirmed the residual pituitary tumor

inclusion.criterion: prior treatments for acromegaly with surgery, somatostatin analogs or pegvisomant are acceptable if these therapies have been discontinued for at least 3 months prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: After his surgery he takes only vitamin D and multivitamins

exclusion.criterion: acromegalic patients currently on a lanreotide or octreotide preparation or on pegvisomant
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients who have received prior radiotherapy or radiosurgery
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients with adenoma-related visual acuity or visual field deficit from optic nerve and/or chiasm compression or severe optic nerve/chiasm compression in the setting of normal visual fields and acuity
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients with pituitary apoplexy defined as recent tumor hemorrhage and/or infarction on MRI with associated symptoms of new onset visual loss, diplopia and/or adrenal insufficiency
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago for acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma.
